intro: Sairocarpus breweri, commonly known as the Brewster's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Sairocarpus breweri is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a rare and endangered species.
